page.title: 03Farming,Abermorddu&District
page.content: David Bannister works full time on his 180 acre farm where he keeps about 80 Freisian cattle mainly for milk and meat .Two fields are used for silage, whilst several acres are kept for growing corn,wheat and potatoes, mostly for sale,but some for use by Mr.Bannister's family. Terry Williams works part_time on his 8 acre smallholding where he grazes a small number of Ayrshire cattle for milk and meat.he grows no crops but gives over two fields for silage. Both men agree that summer is the busiest time and that the main disadvantages of being a farmer are that the day starts very early and is a long one,that work has to be done in all kinds of weather and that the farmer is tied to the farm with little time for recreation or to take a proper holiday,making homelife hard.
